blog.name: brnt0fferings
blog.title: Fanfiction is my Vice
blog.description: Mainly Firefly, Game of Thrones & Inuyasha ♡ I'm always down for checking out new recs! I dabble at the writing part mainly because I have so many plot bunnies in my head and nobody to write them but me 😅

tags: im having way too much fun with this
summary: So I was re-reading Decade by Ann and it occurred to me: where the heck are the fics where Lyanna lives and we get to see how...
body:
ann_and_white_elephant | Archive of Our Own

So I was re-reading Decade by Ann and it occurred to me: where the heck are the fics where Lyanna lives and we get to see how she & Caitlyn get along? I’m talking AU where we ignore any contradictory plot points but still get that Winterfell GoT vibe.

I wanna see a Cat & Lyanna throwdown because I’m crazy and I wanna see someone explore/show that the contempt Cat has toward Jon does not end with him being a bastard. I think how Lyanna did her thing regardless of how it went against family/honor would just rub Cat the wrong way.

How fun would it be to explore those two getting in each others faces? I want Ned to side with his sister and Cat to gnash her teeth together to see how much Arya is like Lyanna 😏 and how inseperable Arya x Jon are. No I dont hate Cat & I’m not trying to make her into a 2D Lady Stonehart/antagonist cliche but I haven’t seen anyone write this angle yet and it occured to me and now I’m obsessed!

Seriously I have so many ideas/what ifs! Someone please make this happen!

so I’m really feeling the arya love lately (aka my entire life) so I was thinking of making a...
body:
discord chat for arya appreciation

so I’m really feeling the arya love lately (aka my entire life) so I was thinking of making a discord chat so we can all rant together about our darling wolf child.

everyone is welcome!

if y’all are interested, send me a message and I’ll give you a link! 🧡

(and if you could help spread the word by signal boosting, that would be amazing!)

blog.title: All These Prompts And I Still Can't Find A Fic
blog.description:
This is a prompt blog. Most of these prompts will be by me and they'll be limited to fandoms I know.

Submissions are acceptable so long as they follow the rules, if not I'll just delete them.

summary: Fandom: Game of Thrones Characters: Arya Stark, Cersei Lannister Warnings: assassination Prompt: Arya Stark returns to the day...
body:
Fandom: Game of Thrones
Characters: Arya Stark, Cersei Lannister
Warnings: assassination

Prompt: Arya Stark returns to the day the King comes to Winterfell and fakes her own death. Possibly at the hands of a Lannister. She then offs Cersei and takes her face.

summary: As she passed the armory, Arya heard the ring of a hammer. A deep orange glow shone through the high windows. She climbed to the...
text:
As she passed the armory, Arya heard the ring of a hammer. A deep orange glow shone through the high windows. She climbed to the roof and peeked down. Gendry was beating out a breastplate. When he worked, nothing existed for him but metal, bellows, fire. The hammer was like part of his arm. She watched the play of muscles in his chest and listened to the steel music he made. He’s strong, she thought. As he took up the long-handled tongs to dip the breastplate into the quenching trough, Arya slithered through the window and leapt down to the floor beside him.
He did not seem surprised to see her. “You should be abed, girl.” The breastplate hissed like a cat as he dipped it in the cold water.

tags: a song of ice and fire
summary: the pack — a poem on house stark
body:
the pack — a poem on house stark

with soft fur and enchanting eyes

you may get lost in their beauty

yet behind the guise of loyalty

is shown to be a beast

the young wolf, with eyes of sky and fur of ginger

an appearance desired by many

yet his personality of honor and courage

is lost to his reckless desires

then the wolf of red, with looks the same as before

with a desperate heart

and wits to last her days

a moment with her is a lifetime of fun

or a last breath to others

the wolf of no name is just like the water

graceful, flowing, smooth

but under attack and the pressure comes down

it may be the last time you move

a wolf with all knowledge

of days of the past

and possibly the future as well

underestimate him, and find out you see

of what else he can possibly do

and at last, the poor cub

a young wolf so dear

with a body that yearns to explore

his mind speaks of the wild and freedom at last

but his home’s only prison alone

speak what you may of the wolves

they may be dumb, stubborn, selfish

but when winter comes and the snow starts to fall

the pack will survive

and those who disrespect them, well

may the seven light their paths

summary: ❝Arya Stark. My name is Arya Stark. And I’m going home❞  “There’s no degree of separation between us. No division. You and me,...
body:
❝Arya Stark. My name is Arya Stark. And I’m going home❞

“There’s no degree of separation between us. No division. You and me, we’re the same person. I am you, you are me. We are who we are, we are what we are. There’s one and only direction: home. We’re going home together”.

—— Arya Stark talking to herself and finding herself againn aesthetic |  © caption by me.

tags: I wrote this on my way to work idk if it makes any sense but here it is oof
summary: What are you theories for Arya in the book? I feel like there’s so much foreshadowing of her becoming queen (Ned telling her...
question: What are you theories for Arya in the book? I feel like there’s so much foreshadowing of her becoming queen (Ned telling her she’ll marry a queen, her naming her wolf after Queen Nymeria and Nymeria being the leader of a giant wolf pack) I feel like we get lots of subtle hints in the book that Arya is growing to be a beautiful woman like Lyanna and that she’ll be the YMBQ and in the end marry Jon
answer:
I definitely think there’s something there in regards to Arya’s queen foreshadowing, but I don’t think it’s to become a queen in the traditional sense, i.e. with a crown and a throne.

To me, the current Westerosi system seems to be failing, and I do believe the North and the Iron Throne are going to be destroyed in the end. When I think of spring, I think of rebirth on top of decay, of something new built on the old. For that to happen, the system can’t be reverted back to the way it once was and it’s going to need certain people to forge the way forward.

That’s where I see Arya coming in. Arya’s journey addresses the parts of society that are collapsing: the treatment of women and the smallfolk, faith, societal standards, respect of power, rule of law etc. It’s through Arya’s (and tbh Jon and Dany’s too) eyes that I personally understand the corruption of the system as a whole, whereas through others, it’s more about the corruption of people themselves. So I do think she’s going to play a role in changing that.

With her references to queens, Nymeria is remembered because she helped start a life for her people when their old lives were destroyed. She kept them together and alive and they followed her to a new world. It’s less about her being a queen to me, and more about what she accomplished.

Similarly, Arya’s name is being used as a rallying cry for the North. She’s already uniting them against the Boltons without being physically present. She kept Gendry and Hot Pie and other outcasts together as well, not because she was their official leader, but they just naturally chose to follow her.

But that’s on the virtue of who she is, not because she’s the Queen, proving that one doesn’t need a crown to bring the world together and drive them forward.

And that’s what I expect from Arya in the end. ASOIAF demonstrates that there are so many different shades of rulers. I don’t see Arya sitting in a castle with a crown on her head and she’s never dreamt of holding absolute power either, but being in a position to create the greatest change.

So when I look at her queen references, I see them more as a sign of someone that might step into a role that belongs to that of a Queen (helping to rebuild the world, keeping the North together etc) but without actually being a literal Queen and holding a singular leadership position, which I attribute to characters that are more trained in that regard, e.g. Dany.

Re: YMBQ, I have zero doubt that it’s Dany and only Dany. Yeah, Arya is growing up to be incredibly lovely, but Cersei is an absolute knock-out. Like oh my god gorgeous. The only person to compete with her is the one who’s literally been called the most beautiful woman in the world. There’s a thousand reasons more why I believe it’s Dany, but point is, nah I don’t think it’s Arya.

Re: marrying Jon, listen, I can’t answer that objectively because I’m Jonrya trash ayy and my opinion is super biased lmao, and I always try to answer these sorts of asks as impartially as I can.

reblog.comment:
I definitely think there’s something there in regards to Arya’s queen foreshadowing, but I don’t think it’s to become a queen in the traditional sense, i.e. with a crown and a throne.

To me, the current Westerosi system seems to be failing, and I do believe the North and the Iron Throne are going to be destroyed in the end. When I think of spring, I think of rebirth on top of decay, of something new built on the old. For that to happen, the system can’t be reverted back to the way it once was and it’s going to need certain people to forge the way forward.

That’s where I see Arya coming in. Arya’s journey addresses the parts of society that are collapsing: the treatment of women and the smallfolk, faith, societal standards, respect of power, rule of law etc. It’s through Arya’s (and tbh Jon and Dany’s too) eyes that I personally understand the corruption of the system as a whole, whereas through others, it’s more about the corruption of people themselves. So I do think she’s going to play a role in changing that.

With her references to queens, Nymeria is remembered because she helped start a life for her people when their old lives were destroyed. She kept them together and alive and they followed her to a new world. It’s less about her being a queen to me, and more about what she accomplished.

Similarly, Arya’s name is being used as a rallying cry for the North. She’s already uniting them against the Boltons without being physically present. She kept Gendry and Hot Pie and other outcasts together as well, not because she was their official leader, but they just naturally chose to follow her.

But that’s on the virtue of who she is, not because she’s the Queen, proving that one doesn’t need a crown to bring the world together and drive them forward.

And that’s what I expect from Arya in the end. ASOIAF demonstrates that there are so many different shades of rulers. I don’t see Arya sitting in a castle with a crown on her head and she’s never dreamt of holding absolute power either, but being in a position to create the greatest change.

So when I look at her queen references, I see them more as a sign of someone that might step into a role that belongs to that of a Queen (helping to rebuild the world, keeping the North together etc) but without actually being a literal Queen and holding a singular leadership position, which I attribute to characters that are more trained in that regard, e.g. Dany.

Re: YMBQ, I have zero doubt that it’s Dany and only Dany. Yeah, Arya is growing up to be incredibly lovely, but Cersei is an absolute knock-out. Like oh my god gorgeous. The only person to compete with her is the one who’s literally been called the most beautiful woman in the world. There’s a thousand reasons more why I believe it’s Dany, but point is, nah I don’t think it’s Arya.

Re: marrying Jon, listen, I can’t answer that objectively because I’m Jonrya trash ayy and my opinion is super biased lmao, and I always try to answer these sorts of asks as impartially as I can.

summary: I would travel miles and miles                  and I would follow any star. I’d go almost any place if it's any place you...
caption:
I would travel miles and miles
                 and I would follow any star.
I’d go almost any place if it’s any place you are.

Frozen AU 
Sansa as Elsa
Arya as Anna
Gendry as Kristoff

blog.name: thestagthatlovedthewolf
blog.title: My obsessions
blog.description: Joana | Veridissima | 22 | Portuguese | Slytherin | Demigod | Born in Idris | Raised aboard the Millenium Falcon | Lived in District 6 | Died in Westeros | Multifandom blog (if it wasn't obvious before), but mostly ASOIAF!!!

summary: I can't get one comment right today - just wrote Gendry instead of Marcus, last comment wrote Abby instead of Betty, and earlier...
body:
I can’t get one comment right today - just wrote Gendry instead of Marcus, last comment wrote Abby instead of Betty, and earlier Alice instead of Arya… 

I normally notice, but sorry if you ever gotten a comment and by mistake I went with another name - I’m a mess sometimes… And it really doesn’t help that Arya, Alice and Abby are all names that start with A…
